states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen for at least one month.
  • Be an Pennsylvania resident, for at least 30 days before the next election.
  • Be at least 18 years old.
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
states.online:
items required

  • PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number

Steps

  1. visit this website to register.
states.inPerson:
items required

  • PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number

Steps

  1. fill out the Pennsylvania Voter Registration Mail Application Form
  2. take the completed form to your county voter registration office
  3. Once your voter registration office processes your application, you will be sent a voter identification card by mail. If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
states.mail:
items required

  • PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number

Steps

  1. fill out the Pennsylvania Voter Registration Mail Application Form
  2. send the completed form to your county voter registration office
  3. Once your voter registration office processes your application, you will be sent a voter identification card by mail. If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
states.absentee:
items required

  • Registered to vote in the state of Pennsylvania
  • The Absentee ballot must be Received by 5:00 p.m. on the Tuesday before Election Day

Steps

  1. Make sure you're registered to vote in the state of Pennsylvania
  2. Go to this website and fill out the form appropriately
  3. Send in your application before the 5 p.m. on the Tuesday before Election day

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Rhode Island resident.
  • Be at least 16 years old(you must be 18 years old to atually vote on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • Not deemed mentally incompetent by the court
states.online:
Items required

  • Some form of identification such as DMV-issued driver's license or RI DMV-ID number.

Steps

  1. visit this website to register.
  2. you can check your voter registration status with the registration tool on the website
states.inPerson:
items required

  • Some form of identification such as DMV-issued driver's license or RI DMV-ID number.

Steps

  1. fill out the Rhode Island Voter Registration Form
  2. take the completed form to your county voter registration office
  3. Once your voter registration office processes your application, you will be sent a voter identification card by mail. If you do not receive your PA voter ID card within 14 days, you should contact your county voter registration office directly.
states.mail:
items required

  • PA driver's liciense or PennDot ID card number or Social security number

Steps

  1. fill out the Rhode Island Voter Registration Form
  2. mail application form to your county's board of canvassers. If you're a first time voter you need to provide ID as well

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an South Carolina resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • Not deemed mentally incompetent by the court
states.online:
Items required

  • Requires South Carolina License or DMV ID
  • if you have moved, you must first update your residence address with DMV

Steps

  1. visit this page to get registered.
states.inPerson:
items required

  • Requires South Carolina License or DMV ID
  • if you have moved, you must first update your residence address with DMV

Steps

  1. Register in person at your county board of voter registration
states.mail:
Items required

  • Requires South Carolina License or DMV ID
  • if you have moved, you must first update your residence address with DMV

Steps

  1. visit this page to get the registration form.
  2. Return the registration form to your county board of voter registration.

states.eligibility:

  • Be an Tennessee resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Requires Social Security Number

Steps

  1. visit this page to get the registration form.

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Texas resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • Not deemed mentally incompetent by the court
states.online:
Items required

  • Requires Texas License or Social Security Number
  • if you have moved, you must first update your residence address with DMV

Steps

  1. visit this page to get registered.
states.inPerson:
items required

  • Requires Texas Driver's License or Social Security Number

Steps

  1. Register in person at your
    • County Voter Registrars' offices
    • At Secretary of State office
  2. your voter registration certificate should be mailed to you in 30 days
states.mail:
Items required

  • Requires Texas Driver's License or Social Security Number

Steps

  1. Request a postage-paid application by filling out this form so that a voter registration application can be mailed to you

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Utah resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • Not deemed mentally incompetent by the court
states.online:
Items required

  • Requires Utah's Drivers license or ID card
  • Address must be up to date in the DLD

Steps

  1. visit this page to get registered.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Requires Utah's Drivers license or ID card
  • Address must be up to date in the DLD

Steps

  1. Register in person at your
    • Local driver license office
    • Local county clerk's office
states.mail:
Items required

  • Requires Utah's Drivers license or ID card
  • Address must be up to date in the DLD

Steps

  1. Fill out the State of Utah Mail-In Voter Registration Form and send it to your local county clerk's office

Items required

  • Requires Vermont's Drivers license or Current bank statements or utility bill or Governement document showing your current residential address

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Wisconsin resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • Not deemed mentally incompetent by the court
states.online:
Items required

  • Requires Wisconsin's Drivers license or Wisconsin ID card
  • Approved proof of residence

Steps

  1. visit this page to get registered.
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Requires Wisconsin's Drivers license or Wisconsin ID card
  • Approved proof of residence

Steps

  1. Register in person with your local municipal clerk
states.mail:
Items required

  • Requires Wisconsin's Drivers license or Wisconsin ID card
  • Approved proof of residence

Steps

  1. Print or get a copy of the Application for Voter Registration (Form EL-131).
  2. submit the form to your local municipal clerk(first-time voters must include proof of residency).

states.eligibility:
Eligibility to register

  • Be a U.S. citizen.
  • Be an Wyoming resident.
  • Be at least 18 years old on election day).
  • NOT been convicted of a disqualifying felony.
  • Not deemed mentally incompetent by the court
states.inPerson:
Items required

  • Proof of Identification which includes
    • Wyoming driver's license
    • Valid U.S passport
    • School or military ID

Steps

  1. If possible, fill out the Wyoming Voter Registration Application and Change Form before you visit the office, to save you time when you get there.
  2. Register in person with your local town or city clerk
states.mail:
Items required

  • Proof of Identification which includes
    • Wyoming driver's license
    • Valid U.S passport
    • School or military ID

Steps

  1. Print or get a copy of the Wyoming Voter Registration Application and Change Form.
  2. You have to fill out the Wyoming Voter Registration Application and Change Form in front of a notary or registry agent
  3. Have the Representitive sign your form and make copies of your proof of ID
